sen.j: 鵲橋（しゃくはし）とは、中国の伝説で旧暦の7月7日 (旧暦)の七夕の日に天の川上にできる橋の名前である。
sen.e: Syakuhashi is the name of bridge which appears on Amanogawa in Chinese legend on the day of Tanabata festival which was taken place on the seventh of July (the old lunisolar calendar).
Syakuhashi is the name of the bridge which appears on the Milky Way in a Chinese legend on the day of Tanabata star festival, the seventh of July in the old lunar calendar.
sen.cmt: 天の川を英語名に変更しました。七夕の説明を追加しました。旧暦の表記を変更しました。
sen.e: Syakuhashi is the name of the bridge which appears on the Milky Way in a Chinese legend on the day of Tanabata star festival, the seventh of July in the old lunar calendar.

sen.j: この橋は織姫と彦星が出会うためにできる。
sen.e: This bridge appears to allow Orihime (Vega) and Hikoboshi (Altair) to meet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This bridge appears to allow Orihime (Vega) and Hikoboshi (Altair) to meet.
This bridge appears to allow Orihime (Vega) and Hikoboshi (Altair) to meet.

sen.j: それゆえ、鵲橋とは男女が良縁で結ばれる事を意味する。
sen.e: So Syakuhashi means that a man and a woman make a good match and get together.
